overview: From 2025-10-01 to 2025-11-01, Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker had 7 new PRs (7 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: add initial implementation of the Sendo Worker
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
Complete implementation of the Sendo Worker orchestrator - a dynamic analysis engine that discovers agent capabilities, executes analysis actions, and generates LLM-powered actionnable recommendations.

## Key Features

### Dynamic Analysis System
- **Action Categorization**: LLM-based classification (DATA vs ACTION)
- **Parallel Execution**: Simultaneous action execution for performance
- **Provider Integration**: Automatic data collection via composeState
- **Smart Selection**: Filters relevant actions before execution

### Analysis Generation
- **4-Section Analysis**: Wallet overview, market conditions, risk assessment, opportunities
- **LLM-Powered**: Uses ModelType.OBJECT_LARGE for comprehensive insights
- **Plugin Attribution**: Cites data sources in analysis

### Recommendations
- **Context-Aware**: Based on analysis results and available actions
- **Double Parallelization**: By action type, then by individual action
- **Executable**: Includes trigger messages for direct execution

### Action Execution
- **Async Processing**: Non-blocking execution with status tracking
- **Real Runtime**: Uses actual processActions() and stateCache
- **Database Persistence**: Tracks status, results, and errors

## Implementation

### Service (946 lines)
\`src/services/sendoWorkerService.ts\`
- categorizeActions() - LLM classification
- collectProviderData() - Via composeState
- selectRelevantDataActions() - Intelligent filtering
- executeAnalysisActions() - Parallel execution
- generateAnalysis() - 4-section analysis
- generateRecommendations() - Context-aware suggestions
- executeActions() - Async execution
- Full CRUD operations

### API Routes (5 endpoints)
\`src/routes/index.ts\`
- GET /analysis - List analyses
- POST /analysis - Run analysis
- GET /analysis/:id/actions - Get recommendations
- GET /action/:id - Get action details
- POST /actions/execute - Execute actions

### Database
\`src/schemas/\`
- analysis_results (id, agentId, analysis, pluginsUsed, executionTimeMs)
- recommended_actions (id, analysisId, actionType, status, result, error, etc.)
- Drizzle ORM with auto-migrations

### Helpers
\`src/utils/actionResult.ts\`
- getActionResultFromCache() - Retrieve from stateCache
- extractErrorMessage() - Clean error extraction

## Documentation

- \`plugin_specification/\` - 8 comprehensive spec files
- \`IMPLEMENTATION_STATUS.md\` - Detailed status vs spec
- \`REPRISE.md\` - Session notes

## Testing

Infrastructure ready, tests to be added in follow-up PR.

topPRs.title: feat: Add comprehensive test infrastructure with real runtime testing
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## üéØ What This Does

Builds a **bulletproof testing system** so we can ship fast without breaking things. No more "works on my machine" surprises!

## ‚ú® Key Changes

### Testing Infrastructure
- **98 automated tests** covering all critical features (63 unit + 27 integration + 8 DB)
- **Fixture-based system**: Centralized test data in `fixtures/llm-responses.ts`
- **Smart test helpers**: Automatically detect prompt types and return correct responses
- **Testing guide**: Complete [`__tests__/README.md`](src/__tests__/README.md) for contributors

### Bug Fixes & Improvements
- ‚úÖ Added `errorType` field to distinguish setup failures vs execution failures
- ‚úÖ Fixed database crash when running ACTION type actions (missing room creation)
- ‚úÖ Refactored mock system - eliminated 176 lines of duplicated code

### Before/After
```typescript
// ‚ùå Before: Copy-paste nightmare repeated in every test
runtime.useModel = mock((options) => {
  if (prompt.includes('GET_WALLET_BALANCE')) {
    return { category: 'DATA', actionType: 'wallet_info' };
  }
  // ... repeated 20+ times across files
});

// ‚úÖ After: One simple line, centralized data
setupLLMMock(runtime, { useFixtures: true });
```

## üìä Test Coverage

**Unit Tests** (63 tests across 9 files):
- Action categorization (6 tests)
- Action execution (8 tests)
- Relevant actions selection (6 tests)
- Analysis generation (5 tests)
- Recommendations generation (7 tests)
- Analysis saving (5 tests)
- Provider data collection (6 tests)
- Decision processing (12 tests)
- DB getters (8 tests)

**Integration Tests** (27 tests):
- Full analysis workflow (8 tests)
- API routes with error handling (19 tests)

**Database Tests** (8 tests)

## üèóÔ∏è Architecture

```
__tests__/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ fixtures/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ llm-responses.ts        # Centralized test data
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ helpers/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test-runtime.ts         # Runtime creation utilities
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ mock-llm.ts             # Intelligent LLM mocking
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ unit/                        # 9 test files
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ integration/                 # 2 test files
```

## üöÄ How to Use

```bash
# Run all tests
bun run test:all

# Run specific suites
bun run test:unit
bun run test:integration

# Debug mode
setupLLMMock(runtime, { useFixtures: true, logPrompts: true });
```

## üìà Stats

- **+3,221 lines** of test infrastructure
- **-176 lines** of old/duplicated code
- **98 tests** passing with 0 failures

## üéØ Impact

- ‚úÖ Ship features faster with confidence
- ‚úÖ Catch bugs before they reach production
- ‚úÖ Easy for new contributors to add tests
- ‚úÖ Consistent, reproducible test results

## üí° Testing Philosophy

- **Real execution paths**: Use actual ElizaOS runtime, not excessive mocking
- **Minimal mocking**: Only mock LLM calls, everything else is real
- **Predictable data**: Fixtures ensure consistent, reproducible tests
- **Easy maintenance**: Centralized data makes updates trivial

## üéØ Next Steps

1. Enhanced seed script using fixtures for realistic demo data
2. Real LLM testing with `USE_REAL_LLM` flag
3. Integration testing with actual ElizaOS plugins (Solana, EVM)

topPRs.title: chore: add GitHub workflows for automated NPM publishing and releases
topPRs.author: M4XGO
topPRs.body:
- Created .release-please-manifest.json to define the release version.
- Added release-please-config.json for release type and changelog configuration.
- Implemented GitHub Actions workflows for automated NPM publishing and release management.


## How : 
Using : https://github.com/Sendo-labs/reusable-workflows/pull/1 to test

topPRs.author: github-actions
topPRs.body:

## 1.0.0 (2025-10-26)


### Features

* Add comprehensive test infrastructure with real runtime testing ([fcf3f9b](https://github.com/Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker/commit/fcf3f9bcae6b7bbaf658fee0a171d86839cc3414))
* add initial implementation of the Sendo Worker ([463e5ff](https://github.com/Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker/commit/463e5fff9c2423438989cbf4b0cd808b08227feb))
* enhance analysis functionality by adding new API route to retrieve analysis by ID, update runAnalysis method to include recommended actions, and implement integration tests for analysis workflow ([ede9796](https://github.com/Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker/commit/ede9796a5d74d681e750449ce72c2470524d15ff))


### Bug Fixes

* **tests:** cast response in categorizeActions test to any for TypeScript compatibility ([b13670b](https://github.com/Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker/commit/b13670bda791ecadf75ceb5922a85abb370a17e2))

---

completedItems.title: Refactor to use official Eliza getActionResults API
completedItems.body:

- Replace internal `stateCache` access with official `runtime.getActionResults()` API
- Add proper `HandlerOptions` typing in test helpers  
- Fix params format in REBALANCE_PORTFOLIO fixture to match Zod schema

All

topContributors.summary: standujar: Focused on foundational development, establishing several new systems and plugins this month. They delivered the initial implementation for the Sendo Worker in a significant PR (Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker#1, +13194 lines) and also set up the initial project structure for the frontend (Sendo-labs/frontend#2) and the CryptoScore plugin (Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore#1). Their work also included initializing the contributor tracking system (Sendo-labs/leaderboard#1) and adding JSON endpoints to it (Sendo-labs/leaderboard#4). This activity demonstrates a strong focus on bootstrapping new features and core infrastructure.

Neysixx: Drove significant foundational improvements in the Sendo-labs/frontend repository, focusing primarily on large-scale refactoring. Their most impactful contribution was a massive project-wide refactor to update the structure and configurations (Sendo-labs/frontend#1), involving over 34,000 line changes. Alongside this, Neysixx delivered new pages (Sendo-labs/frontend#7), improved the existing page structure (Sendo-labs/frontend#3), and resolved a critical build issue by adding missing dependencies (Sendo-labs/frontend#5). This activity demonstrates a clear focus on refactoring, which constituted the majority of their work.

xdrkush: This month, xdrkush made foundational contributions to the new `Sendo-labs/sendo-api` repository. They initiated the project with a significant PR (#1) that added over 21,000 lines of code, establishing the service's groundwork. Following this, they addressed an issue with buy/sell accounts in a subsequent fix (PR #3). Their efforts were primarily focused on a mix of feature work and bug fixes within this new API.

M4XGO: Focused on establishing foundational development workflows and release processes this month. They implemented a significant new CI/CD setup in Sendo-labs/reusable-workflows#1, adding over 1000 lines of configuration to create reusable workflows and manage releases. M4XGO also extended this automation to enable NPM publishing for a separate plugin via Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore#2. Their work was concentrated entirely in configuration and documentation files, reflecting a clear focus on improving repository infrastructure and automation.

0xCanet: This month, 0xCanet's work was focused on establishing the new `Sendo-labs/frontend` repository. They merged a single, substantial pull request (Sendo-labs/frontend#1) that served as the initial commit for the project. This foundational work introduced over 9,200 lines of code across 111 files, setting up the new codebase.

MonteCrypto999: Focused on a major new feature this month, opening a substantial pull request to add referral fee support in Sendo-labs/plugin-jupiter (#1). This work-in-progress is extensive, introducing nearly 6,000 lines of code across 31 files. The changes indicate a comprehensive effort spanning feature implementation, configuration, bugfixes, and tests.

0domart: This month, 0domart focused on core functionality for the Sendo-labs/spotlight repository, opening a pull request to implement SOL transfer logic (Sendo-labs/spotlight#1). This single, substantial contribution modified 12 files with over 1,500 lines of new code. The work shows a strong emphasis on quality and correctness, with a primary focus on building out the associated unit tests.

tionebDotsamapha: This month, tionebDotsamapha's work was centered on improving project documentation. Their sole merged pull request (Sendo-labs/sendo-api#2) updated the README file to English, a significant change of 71 lines that improves the project's accessibility. This contribution reflects a focus entirely on documentation.

Fleo-Thyphon-ElizaOS: made a substantial number of local code changes this month, modifying 49 files across 3 commits. This effort resulted in a significant volume of code changes (+29801/-7379 lines), though this work has not yet been submitted as a pull request. The commits indicate a focus on bug fixes and other general work.
